10. References

1

DNVGL. Environmental conditions and environmental loads. Recommended Practice DNV-RP-C205, DNVGL, 9 2019.

2

Odd Faltinsen. Sea loads on ships and offshore structures. Volume 1. Cambridge university press, 1993.

3

Thomas B Johannessen and Chris Swan. A laboratory study of the focusing of transient and directionally spread surface water waves. In Proceedings of the Royal Society of London A: Mathematical, Physical and Engineering Sciences, volume 457, 971–1006. The Royal Society, 2001.

4

Thomas Berge Johannessen. The effect of directionality on the nonlinear behaviour of extreme transient ocean waves. PhD thesis, Imperial College London (University of London), 1997.

5

EH Kennard. Generation of surface waves by a moving partition. Quarterly of applied mathematics, 7(3):303–312, 1949.

6

JN Sharma, RG Dean, and others. Second-order directional seas and associated wave forces. Society of Petroleum Engineers Journal, 21(01):129–140, 1981.

7

Lars Skjelbreia and James Hendrickson. Fifth order gravity wave theory. Coastal Engineering Proceedings, pages 10–10, 1960.

8

PB Smit, TT Janssen, and THC Herbers. Nonlinear wave kinematics near the ocean surface. Journal of Physical Oceanography, 47(7):1657–1673, 2017.
